question_title: What will be the value of "Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 3-Year Constant Maturity, Quoted on an Investment Basis" on 2026-02-10?
summary: Short-horizon forecast for 3-year Treasury yield (DGS3). Current value is 3.60% as of Jan 30, 2026. The Fed held rates steady in January with no meeting before resolution. Hawkish signals from Kevin Warsh nomination and strong manufacturing data provide slight upward pressure, but the short 7-day horizon limits expected movement. Jobs report on Feb 7 is the main uncertainty. Distribution centered at 3.62% with ~12 bps standard deviation using fat tails for robustness.

factors.description: Current value anchor: DGS3 at 3.60% as of Jan 30, 2026 - short horizon favors stability around this level
Hawkish Fed signals: Warsh nomination and strong manufacturing data suggest slight upward pressure on yields
Fed held rates steady: No rate change at January meeting, next meeting not until March - limits volatility
Jobs report on Feb 7: Key uncertainty that could move yields ±5-8 bps if it surprises
Recent range-bound trading: Yields have traded 3.60-3.66% over past week, suggesting near-term stability
